CSD203.name: Introduction to Communicative Sciences and Disorders
CSD203.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSD203.description: Survey of research and practice regarding speech, hearing, and language disorders in children and adults.

CSD213.name: Anatomy and Physiology of the Speech and Hearing Mechanisms
CSD213.description: Structural and functional analyses of the central and peripheral auditory mechanisms, and of the respiratory, phonatory, and articulatory mechanisms for speech.

CSD232.name: Descriptive Phonetics
CSD232.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSD232.description: Principles of speech production. Transcription of speech using the International Phonetic Alphabet.

CSD303.name: Fundamentals of Hearing
CSD303.description: Physical and psychological aspects of hearing. Measurement of hearing thresholds. Binaural hearing.

CSD313.name: Speech Science
CSD313.description: Processes underlying the production and perception of speech.

CSD333.name: Oral Language Development
CSD333.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSD333.description: Development of receptive and expressive aspects of child language.

CSD364.name: Speech and Language Disorders and their Evaluation
CSD364.description: Evaluation procedures in speech-language pathology. Testing. Analysis of results. Report writing.

CSD391.name: Observation and Analysis of Clinical Practice
CSD391.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSD391.description: Case presentations. Interviewing techniques. Behavioral observation and data collection. Behavior management. Counseling. Session plan and report writing.

CSD419.name: International Aspects of Communicative Disorders
CSD419.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSD419.description: Human communication disorders in international settings.
CSD419.prerequisite: CSD 213 and CSD 303 and CSD 313 and CSD 333

CSD463.name: Intervention/Rehabilitation Procedures in Speech-Language Pathology
CSD463.description: Intervention and rehabilitation procedures for individuals with developmental and acquired communication disorders.

CSD483.name: School-Based Communicative Disorders Programs
CSD483.description: Administrative, regulatory, and practice aspects of school-based programs for persons with communicative disorders.

CSD490.name: Independent Study
CSD490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSD490.description: Individualized student activities in human communicative sciences and disorders.

CSD491.name: Topics in Communicative Sciences and Disorders
CSD491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSD491.description: Varying topics related to normal or disordered communication.

CSD803.name: Research Methods in Communicative Sciences and Disorders
CSD803.description: Hypothesis generation, experimental design, data collection, data analysis, and presentation.
CSD803.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD813.name: Neuroanatomy and Neurophysiology of Speech, Language, and Hearing
CSD813.description: Structural and functional descriptions of the nervous system as it relates to communication sciences and disorders.
CSD813.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD815.name: Acquired Language Disorders
CSD815.description: Neuropathology, symptomatology, and speech-language rehabilitation of individuals with aphasia and related disorders.
CSD815.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD819.name: Cognitive-Communicative Disorders
CSD819.description: Neurophysiological, speech-language, cognitive, neuropsychological, and social/emotional rehabilitation associated with traumatic brain injury, dementia, and right hemisphere neurological disorders.
CSD819.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD820.name: Language Assessment and Intervention: Early Stages
CSD820.description: Nature, characteristics, evaluation, assessment, diagnosis, and intervention for children with developmental language and related disorders from infancy through preschool

CSD821.name: Language Assessment and Intervention: Later Stages
CSD821.description: Nature, characteristics, evaluation, assessment, diagnosis, and intervention for children with developmental language and related disorders from early school years through adolescence
CSD821.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD830.name: Fluency Disorders
CSD830.description: History, theories, symptomatology, diagnosis, and treatment of fluency disorders in children and adults.
CSD830.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD840.name: Voice Disorders
CSD840.description: Etiology, symptomatology, diagnosis, and treatment of voice disorders in children and adults.
CSD840.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD850.name: Medical Aspects of Speech-Language Pathology
CSD850.description: Introduction to assessment, intervention, and management of persons with laryngectomy, tracheostomy, ventilator-dependence, and cleft lip and palate. Intensive study of the clinical procedures and instrumentation employed by speech-language pathologists who practice in medical settings.
CSD850.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD855.name: Assessment and Treatment of Dysphagia
CSD855.description: Introduction to assessment, intervention, and management of persons with swallowing disorders.
CSD855.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD860.name: Articulation and Phonological Disorders
CSD860.description: Nature, basis, assessment, and treatment of developmental phonological disorders

CSD865.name: Motor Speech Disorders
CSD865.description: Neuropathology, symptomatology, and speech-language habilitation and rehabilitation of individuals with motor speech disorders.
CSD865.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD880.name: Clinical Proseminar in Communicative Sciences and Disorders
CSD880.description: Preparation for clinical practicum placements including review of professional conduct, practice settings, caseload management, and documentation.
CSD880.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD883.name: Clinical Practicum in Speech-Language Pathology
CSD883.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSD883.description: Supervised clinical experience in the management of clients with speech-language disorders.
CSD883.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders.

CSD888.name: Counseling in Communicative Disorders
CSD888.description: Overview of counseling issues related to communication disorders.

CSD890.name: Independent Study
CSD890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSD890.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Communicative Sciences and Disorders major. Approval of department.

CSD899.name: Master's Thesis Research
CSD899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSD899.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders. Approval of department.

CSD990.name: Independent Study
CSD990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSD990.restrictions: Open to graduate students. Approval of department.

CSD991.name: Special Topics in Communicative Sciences and Disorders
CSD991.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSD991.description: Selected topics in human communication and its disorders.
CSD991.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders or approval of department.

CSD992.name: Seminar in Communicative Sciences and Disorders
CSD992.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSD992.description: Topical themes in human communication and its disorders.
CSD992.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders. Approval of department.

CSD994.name: Research Practicum in Communicative Sciences and Disorders
CSD994.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

CSD999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
CSD999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSD999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Communicative Sciences and Disorders. Approval of department.
